intro: Vaccinium tepuiense, commonly known as the tepui vaccinium, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the tepuis of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. This plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude, humid environments with well-drained acidic soils. Due to its restricted distribution and unique ecological niche, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
